title: Connector Articles - Date Wrong on Connector
text: Date Wrong on Connector 31 January 2023 16:07 Sometimes pulling new docker images on the connectors may fail if the date is set incorrectly. We've seen some connectors resetting their time/date back a few years following a reboot. You can check the current time/date set on the connector by running 'date'. If the date & time is wrong you can manually update by running the following: sudo date --set "Mon Oct 10 12:30:00 CEST 2022"
description:
Date Wrong on Connector

31 January 2023

16:07

 

Sometimes pulling new docker images on the connectors may fail if the date is set incorrectly. We've seen some connectors resetting their time/date back a few years following a reboot.

 

You can check the current time/date set on the connector by running 'date'.

 

If the date & time is wrong you can manually update by running the following:

sudo date --set "Mon Oct 10 12:30:00 CEST 2022"

title: Connector Articles - Accessing Docker Logs
text: Accessing Docker Logs 31 January 2023 16:10 When troubleshooting connector issues sometimes it's necessary to check the docker container logs. Run the following command to read the logs: "docker logs -f compose_armgateway_1" (Replacing 'armgateway' with the required Image name "docker ps -a" can be used to list all the image names if required) The log should update in real-time. To exit the log press CTRL + Z.
description:
Accessing Docker Logs

31 January 2023

16:10

 

When troubleshooting connector issues sometimes it's necessary to check the docker container logs. 

 

Run the following command to read the logs:

"docker logs -f compose_armgateway_1" (Replacing 'armgateway' with the required Image name "docker ps -a" can be used to list all the image names if required)

 

The log should update in real-time. To exit the log press CTRL + Z.

title: Connector Articles - Docker down/docker up
text: Docker down / docker up 27 May 2022 15:16 Software restart of the connector. https://portal.k3imagine.com/support/#/ Log into Imagine: Choose PLATFORM ADMIN Choose CONNECTORS Search for the connector and click on it Choose Connectors and choose the connector you want to restart Choose Command, locate dockerdown and click on it Click Execute Command (DockerDown) Repeat procedure to run Docker Up. Or: /pinging with the connector NB: Remember to close down browser when doing the command Or use Putty.exe: Copy Putty.exe to customers computer and install it. Run CMD as Administrator Type Ipconfig and press Enter to find the IP Address Start Putty.exe Enter IP Address Click Open Log in with Username: pirate Password: l2k0110team Type cd compose Type docker-compose down Type docker-compose pull Type docker-compose up -d
description:
Docker down / docker up

27 May 2022

15:16

 

Software restart of the connector.

 

https://portal.k3imagine.com/support/#/

 

Log into Imagine:

 

 

  1. Choose PLATFORM ADMIN

      
  2. Choose CONNECTORS

 

 

  1. Search for the connector and click on it

 

 

  1. Choose Connectors and choose the connector you want to restart

 

  1. Choose Command, locate dockerdown and click on it

 

 

  1. Click Execute Command (DockerDown)

 

  1. Repeat procedure to run Docker Up.

 

Or:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

/pinging with the connector

 

NB: Remember to close down browser when doing the command

 

Or use Putty.exe:

 

  1. Copy Putty.exe to customers computer and install it.

 

 

  1. Run CMD as Administrator

 

 

  1. Type Ipconfig and press Enter to find the IP Address

 

 

  1. Start Putty.exe

 

  1. Enter IP Address

 

 

  1. Click Open

 

  1. Log in with

Username: pirate

Password: l2k0110team

 

  1. Type cd compose

 

  1. Type docker-compose down

 

  1. Type docker-compose pull

 

  1. Type docker-compose up -d

title: Connector Articles - Restart connector
text: Restart connector 27 May 2022 15:19 Push the small power button until the blue light goes off – about 20 seconds. Then push it again to start the connector again. To remotely reboot a connector SSH/Putty into it and run "sudo reboot". You can also send the reboot command to the connector from Platform admin. Navigate to Platform Admin. Search for the Required tenant & Navigate to Connector Tab You can see if the command has been completed by expanding the connector and clicking on the history tab:
description:
Restart connector

27 May 2022

15:19

 

 

Push the small power button until the blue light goes off – about 20 seconds. Then push it again to start the connector again.

 

 

To remotely reboot a connector SSH/Putty into it and run "sudo reboot". You can also send the reboot command to the connector from Platform admin.


  • Navigate to Platform Admin.
  • Search for the Required tenant & Navigate to Connector Tab
  • You can see if the command has been completed by expanding the connector and clicking on the history tab:

title: Connector Articles - Where to find customers Connector and Card Terminal details
text: Where to find customers Connector and Card Terminal details 26 July 2022 13:47 How to find setup details of card terminal in Imagine The customers card terminal local IP address, login pin and merchant ID can be found by logging into the customers Tenant. Usually by a K3admin login. Navigate to the Admin Module then Manage K3 Connector. This is where you will find these details which are needed when proving if the Terminal is on the network by doing a ping from the customers internal network. It also has the login pin if the Ped asks for these to be entered manually. The Merchant ID will be required when going back to the Terminal provider if this needs replaced etc. See page below.
description:
Where to find customers Connector and Card Terminal details

26 July 2022

13:47

 

How to find setup details of card terminal in Imagine 

The customers card terminal local IP address, login pin and merchant ID can be found by logging into the customers Tenant. Usually by a K3admin login.

 

Navigate to the Admin Module then Manage K3 Connector. This is where you will find these details which are needed when proving if the Terminal is on the network by doing a ping from the customers internal network. It also has the login pin if the Ped asks for these to be entered manually. 

 

The Merchant ID will be required when going back to the Terminal provider if this needs replaced etc. See page below.

title: Customer display on 2nd monitor
text: If the customer would like the customer display to be automatically on the correct monitor when starting up you could do the following: First click on any empty spot on your desktop and click on Display Settings. Identify which monitor is your customer display and remember this for later. Go to POS ADMIN > POS Options > Customer Display > And select either monitor 1 or 2 (or higher) depending which one is your customer display.
description:
If the customer would like the customer display to be automatically on the correct monitor when starting up you could do the following: 

 

First click on any empty spot on your desktop and click on Display Settings.  

 

Identify which monitor is your customer display and remember this for later. 

 

Go to POS ADMIN > POS Options > Customer Display > And select either monitor 1 or 2 (or higher) depending which one is your customer display.

title: Accessing Connector using Mac OS
text: In order to access the connector from a Mac OS machine it is necessary to open the Terminal application. Click the Launchpad icon in the Dock, type Terminal in the search field, then click Terminal. Alternatively you can press the F4 key and it should launch the Terminal App. This will look like below and from here you can connect to the Connector using it's IP address (which can be found from Platform Admin) with the following command ssh pirate@"ipaddress" Once connected the normal connector commands can be executed. Typing quit at the prompt will exit the terminal App.
description:
In order to access the connector from a Mac OS machine it is necessary to open the Terminal application.


  • Click the Launchpad icon  in the Dock, type Terminal in the search field, then click Terminal.


Alternatively you can press the F4 key and it should launch the Terminal App.


This will look like below and from here you can connect to the Connector using it's IP address (which can be found from Platform Admin) with the following command


ssh pirate@"ipaddress"




Once connected the normal connector commands can be executed. Typing quit at the prompt will exit the terminal App.

title: Connector fails to print status stub after restart. Docker login issue.
text: On occasion after an update a Connector will fail to login to Docker which in turn will not allow it to mount the container services. It will usually give an error message similar to below where it will complain about client ID or Client secret. This will manifest by not printing any status stub from the receipt printer even after a power cycle of the Connector as none of the docker services are able to start. Upon ssh or putty onto the Connector you will receive the error below when you try to docker-compose up -d and it errors. By running a series of comands from Platform Admin on the Connector this can usually be corrected. E.g. Go to the desired Connector in Platform Admin and Execute the commands in this order. These commands can be run manually from an ssh or putty prompt although it is advisable to run the LogintoDockerregistry from Platform Admin first as it will use the up to date password details.
description:
On occasion after an update a Connector will fail to login to Docker which in turn will not allow it to mount the container services. It will usually give an error message similar to below where it will complain about client ID or Client secret. This will manifest by not printing any status stub from the receipt printer even after a power cycle of the Connector as none of the docker services are able to start. Upon ssh or putty onto the Connector you will receive the error below when you try to docker-compose up -d and it errors.




By running a series of comands from Platform Admin on the Connector this can usually be corrected.


E.g.


Go to the desired Connector in Platform Admin and Execute the commands in this order.






These commands can be run manually from an ssh or putty prompt although it is advisable to run the LogintoDockerregistry from Platform Admin first as it will use the up to date password details.

title: Connector Articles - ERR_CERT_DATE_INVALID
text: If the connector appears to be offline in imagine POS, blinking red like shown below: But all other signs show that the connector is online(can be pinged, rebooted, updated etc.) Check for errors in the browser Dev tools: If you get the error "ERR_CERT_DATE_INVALID" it is likely that the time and date in the POS PC itself is out of sync, and needs to be corrected. This is done in windows settings, in "Date and time" Press the "Sync now" button, make sure the clock is correct, and then reboot windows. After a reboot of windows, the connector and POS should reestablish their connection.
description:
If the connector appears to be offline in imagine POS, blinking red like shown below: 


But all other signs show that the connector is online(can be pinged, rebooted, updated etc.)


Check for errors in the browser Dev tools:



If you get the error "ERR_CERT_DATE_INVALID" it is likely that the time and date in the POS PC itself is out of sync, and needs to be corrected. 


This is done in windows settings, in "Date and time"

Press the "Sync now" button, make sure the clock is correct, and then reboot windows. 


After a reboot of windows, the connector and POS should reestablish their connection.

Run the following command to read the logs: "docker logs -f compose_armgateway_1" (Replacing 'armgateway' with the required Image name "docker ps -a" can be used to list all the image names if required) The log should update in real-time. To exit the log press CTRL + Z.

title: Docker down / Docker up
text: Software restart of the connector. https://portal.k3imagine.com/support/#/ Log into Imagine: Choose PLATFORM ADMIN Choose CONNECTORS Search for the connector and click on it Choose Connectors and choose the connector you want to restart Choose Command, locate dockerdown and click on it Click Execute Command (DockerDown) Repeat procedure to run Docker Up. Or: /pinging with the connector NB: Remember to close down browser when doing the command Or use Putty.exe: Copy Putty.exe to customers computer and install it. Run CMD as Administrator Type Ipconfig and press Enter to find the IP Address Start Putty.exe Enter IP Address Click Open Log in with Username: ask support Password: ask support Type cd compose Type docker-compose down Type docker-compose pull Type docker-compose up -d
description:
Software restart of the connector. 

 

https://portal.k3imagine.com/support/#/ 

 

Log into Imagine: 

 

 

  1. Choose PLATFORM ADMIN 
     
     

  2. Choose CONNECTORS 

 

 

  1. Search for the connector and click on it 

 

 

  1. Choose Connectors and choose the connector you want to restart 

 

  1. Choose Command, locate dockerdown and click on it 

 

 

  1. Click Execute Command (DockerDown) 

 

  1. Repeat procedure to run Docker Up. 

 

Or: 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  

/pinging with the connector 

  

NB: Remember to close down browser when doing the command 

  

Or use Putty.exe: 

  

  1. Copy Putty.exe to customers computer and install it. 

 

  

  1. Run CMD as Administrator 

 

 

  1. Type Ipconfig and press Enter to find the IP Address 

 

  

  1. Start Putty.exe 

  

  1. Enter IP Address 

 

  

  1. Click Open 

 

  1. Log in with 

Username: ask support 

Password: ask support

 

  1. Type cd compose 

 

  1. Type docker-compose down 

 

  1. Type docker-compose pull 

 

  1. Type docker-compose up -d

title: Where to find customers Connector and Card Terminal details
text: How to find setup details of card terminal in Imagine The customers card terminal local IP address, login pin and merchant ID can be found by logging into the customers Tenant. Usually by a K3admin login. Navigate to the Admin Module then Manage K3 Connector. This is where you will find these details which are needed when proving if the Terminal is on the network by doing a ping from the customers internal network. It also has the login pin if the Ped asks for these to be entered manually. The Merchant ID will be required when going back to the Terminal provider if this needs replaced etc. See page below.
description:
How to find setup details of card terminal in Imagine  

The customers card terminal local IP address, login pin and merchant ID can be found by logging into the customers Tenant. Usually by a K3admin login. 

 

Navigate to the Admin Module then Manage K3 Connector. This is where you will find these details which are needed when proving if the Terminal is on the network by doing a ping from the customers internal network. It also has the login pin if the Ped asks for these to be entered manually.  

 

The Merchant ID will be required when going back to the Terminal provider if this needs replaced etc. See page below.

title: Manuel update of Connector via Putty
text: Manuel update of Connector SSH into Connector from support Tools or install Putty https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/latest.html If you are using Putty, insert Connector IP here and press “Open” Login to connector is: pirate l2k0110team Then do following commands cd compose // navigates to the compose folder docker-compose down // Closes programs running on the connector docker-compose pull // Checks for updates if the update fails with missing login, type following: Then do docker-compose pull again docker-compose up -d // Starts up connector docker ps -a // Checks if everything is running When error acure: cd obeyer/ wget -O /home/pirate/obeyer/obeyer.py https://k3imagine.com/connector/obeyer.py ______________________________________________________________________ New connector the docker registry needs authorisation to pull new images from and sometimes the password changes, especially with older connectors or ones that have been in storage it'll be necessary to run that command
description:
Manuel update of Connector

SSH into Connector from support Tools or install Putty

https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/latest.html

If you are using Putty, insert Connector IP here and press “Open”





Login to connector is:

pirate

l2k0110team

 

Then do following commands 

cd compose                        // navigates to the compose folder

docker-compose down  // Closes programs running on the connector

docker-compose pull      // Checks for updates

if the update fails with missing login, type following: 

 

Then do docker-compose pull again

docker-compose up -d   // Starts up connector

 

docker ps -a                        // Checks if everything is running

 

 

When error acure:

cd obeyer/

 

wget -O /home/pirate/obeyer/obeyer.py https://k3imagine.com/connector/obeyer.py

 

______________________________________________________________________

New connector

 

 

the docker registry needs authorisation to pull new images from and sometimes the password changes, especially with older connectors or ones that have been in storage it'll be necessary to run that command
